result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert Milton Bully appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Craig Robert Johnson appeared by video for Robert Milton Bully.  Attorney Thomas Hasle in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02. Bail/bond hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bail

Defendant Robert Milton Bully in court, in custody.  Attorney Craig Robert Johnson in court for Robert Milton Bully.  Attorney Gerald Alder in court for State of Wisconsin on behalf of Attorney James Griffin. 

Case in court for a State v Lee hearing.  Attorney Craig Johnson recently appointed.  Court scheduled a preliminary hearing.  Case adjourned to Branch PE, Rm 146 CJF.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Attorney Craig Johnson

Defendant Robert Milton Bully appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status of counsel hearing.  State Public Defender's Office has not yet appointed an attorney.  Court finds good cause to allow the SPD's Office time to appoint an attorney.  However, court schedules a State v. Lee hearing.  SPD's Office notified of next court date.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Robert Milton Bully not in court.  Attorney Stephen Sargent appeared as friend of the court.  Attorney Samuel Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin on behalf of Attorney James C Griffin.  

Case in court for a status of counsel.  State Public Defender's Office has not yet appointed counsel.  Defendant in custody at the House of Corrections. State informs the court that this case has been incorrectly assigned to Branch 36 and should be re-tabbed to Branch 02, Judge Childs.  Court scheduled a status of counsel hearing in Branch 02.  SPD's office notified of next court date.  Case adjourned to Branch 02, Rm 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Robert Milton Bully not in court, defendant in custody at HOC.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. Case is adjourned. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for Status of Counsel.  Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report.  Received and Filed.  nk

Defendant Robert Milton Bully not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests that this matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status; denied.  Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Dollar General, Walgreens, TSS, ARG, JJR, GS, JM, or the co-actor, Charles Evans
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Robert Milton Bully in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Robert Milton Bully in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Court advised defendant that due to nature of offense in Count 1-2 a sample of your DNA is required.  If the sheriff's department hasn't already obtained a sample I order them to do so.  There are circumstances that you can request the sample to be expunged from the data base pursuant to statute 165.77(4). DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse.
  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Robert Milton Bully not in court.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.'
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Defendant was in MPD custody and in the hospital. Defendant was released and MPD gave him an ordered date for 7/5/2022 at 1:00 p.m.
